While it is easier and faster to travel between

by taking a three-hour direct flight, driving has its own advantages with little trips and diversions that may be taken along the way. The most direct route is 874km on the Hume Highway (Highway 31), a majority dual-carriage motorway. For those with time to spare, there is the Princes Highway which follows the coast for most of its length, although not necessarily within sight of the sea. Other alternate inland roads include the Olympic Highway between
, and also the Monaro Highway route via

The road is busy during the summer season, with many accommodations booked fully. A spot of good weather in either spring or fall is often the best time to enjoy the coastal road, although hard to plan for.

generally takes at least a minimum of 10 hours when following the speed limit, hence it is advisable to take several breaks along the way to break up the journey. Speed cameras are aplenty, whether mobile or fixed, as well as newer point-to-point speed cameras, which measure whether too little time is taken to travel over a certain distance (ie speeding). There are also many highway patrols and you may see a fine coming your way if you are heavy on the gas pedal.
A fairly straightforward if boring route that is mostly highway.

value: as a good halfway point for a short break, with iconic Dog on the Tucker Box.

can be done with an overnight stop within two days, although you could probably take some time and spend at least four days on the road, with a couple of hours at each stop to thoroughly enjoy the

. Lots of wildlife from whales, dolphins to seals if you keep an eye out, and plenty of seagulls and pelicans. are hidden gems where wild Eastern Grey Kangaroos can be found feeding peacefully. Contrary to the name, Pebbly Beach has great sand, though you'll have to step more carefully through the grass patches thanks to the kangaroos. There's also a good trail to walk on Durras Beach.
